revision_content.description: Explore shapes, sizes, angles, and the properties of space to understand how objects relate and interact in 2D and 3D.

subtopics.title: Basic Geometric Terms
subtopics.definition: These are the building blocks of geometry including points, lines, and planes.

example.question: What do we call a flat surface that extends infinitely?

subtopics.whyItMatters: Understanding the basics helps build more complex geometric ideas.
quickTips: A point shows location but has no size.
A line is infinite in both directions.

subtopics.title: Types of Angles
subtopics.definition: Angles are formed when two rays meet at a point. They are classified by their size.
subtopics.whyItMatters: Angles are everywhere – doors, ramps, art, design – recognizing them helps in real-world design.

subtopics.title: Triangles and Their Types
subtopics.definition: A triangle is a 3-sided polygon with different types based on sides and angles.

example.question: Name a triangle with all sides equal.

subtopics.whyItMatters: Triangles form the base of many structures and appear often in technical fields.

subtopics.title: Properties of Triangles
subtopics.definition: Rules that govern triangle angles, sides, and symmetry.

example.question: What is the sum of interior angles of a triangle?

subtopics.whyItMatters: These rules help solve geometric problems quickly.
quickTips: Exterior angle = sum of opposite interior angles
Isosceles triangles have 2 equal sides & angles

subtopics.title: Quadrilaterals
subtopics.definition: Four-sided polygons like squares, rectangles, trapeziums, and parallelograms.

example.question: Which quadrilateral has all angles 90° and all sides equal?

subtopics.whyItMatters: Used in design, architecture, and layout planning.
quickTips: Opposite sides of a rectangle are equal

subtopics.title: Congruency and Similarity
subtopics.definition: Congruent shapes are exactly the same size and shape; similar shapes have the same shape but different sizes.

example.question: Are two triangles with equal angles but different side lengths similar or congruent?

subtopics.whyItMatters: Helps in resizing, scaling, and pattern recognition.

subtopics.title: Circles
subtopics.definition: A set of points that are all the same distance from a fixed center point.

example.question: What is the formula for the area of a circle?

subtopics.whyItMatters: Circles appear in wheels, gears, logos, art, and real-world motion.

subtopics.title: Geometrical Constructions
subtopics.definition: Drawing shapes, angles, and lines accurately using a compass and ruler.

example.question: Which tool is used to draw arcs and angles accurately?

subtopics.whyItMatters: Precision drawing is vital in engineering, design, and art.
quickTips: Use compass for accuracy – no eyeballing!

subtopics.title: 3D Shapes and Nets
subtopics.definition: 3D shapes have length, width, and height. Nets are 2D layouts that fold into 3D shapes.

example.question: What 3D shape has one curved surface and one flat circular face?

subtopics.whyItMatters: Helps understand how real-world objects are structured.
quickTips: Volume = space inside; Surface Area = total outer area
Practice drawing nets to improve spatial thinking
